name: setup
description: Opens the full server configuration wizard. Walks you through mod log channel, welcome messages, economy settings, DJ roles, leveling, tickets, and the Agent Pool — all in one place. Run once on a fresh install or whenever you need to reconfigure.

subcommandsRich.name: wizard
subcommandsRich.desc: Launch the full interactive setup wizard

subcommandsRich.name: status
subcommandsRich.desc: Show current setup status across all modules

subcommandsRich.name: leveling
subcommandsRich.desc: Configure XP, level-up messages and role rewards

name: dashboard
summary: Live server dashboard with interactive controls
description: Displays a real-time dashboard embed showing bot health, active agent sessions, economy stats, and quick-action buttons for common mod tasks. Only admins can trigger actions; everyone can view.

name: prefix
summary: View or change the command prefix
description: With no argument, shows the current prefix. Pass a value (1–4 characters) to change it. Anyone can view; only members with Manage Server can change it.

name: config
description: Per-module settings not covered by /setup. Covers AI provider selection, economy multipliers, XP rates, announcement channels, and timezone.

name: help
summary: Browse all prefix commands and slash commands
description: Interactive help browser. Browse by category, search by name, or look up a specific command. Shows usage, aliases, examples, and permission level.

subcommandsRich.name: search
subcommandsRich.desc: Search for a command by keyword

subcommandsRich.name: command
subcommandsRich.desc: Get detailed info on a specific command

subcommandsRich.name: prefix
subcommandsRich.desc: List all prefix commands for a category

name: automod
description: Set up spam detection, bad-word filters, mention limits, link blocking, and raid-detection thresholds. Each rule has an action (warn, mute, kick, ban) and can be scoped to channels or roles.

name: welcome
summary: Set up welcome and farewell messages
description: Configure the welcome channel, embed message, and farewell message. Supports {user}, {server}, {membercount} placeholders. Can also assign a welcome role on join.

name: autorole
summary: Roles automatically assigned on member join
description: Add or remove roles from the autorole list. Members receive all autorole roles the moment they join the server.

name: roles
summary: Reaction roles and self-assignable role menus
description: Create role menus with dropdown selects or reaction-based assignment. Useful for colour roles, pronoun roles, or notification opt-ins.

name: tickets
description: Set up support ticket channels: create panel, define staff roles, configure transcript channel, and set ticket naming format. Members open tickets with a button.

name: mod
description: Slash command equivalents of the prefix moderation commands. Useful when you want the Discord context-menu integration or ephemeral responses. Prefix equivalents also exist for every subcommand.

name: levels
description: Configure the leveling system: enable/disable, set XP per message, configure level-up announcement channel, and manage level role rewards.

name: music
description: Slash command interface to the music system. All subcommands mirror their prefix equivalents. Most users prefer the prefix commands (!play, !skip etc.) but slash works too.

subcommandsRich.name: play
subcommandsRich.desc: Play or queue a track — search or URL

name: agents
summary: Manage and deploy community Agent Pool agents
description: View available agents, deploy an agent to a voice channel, configure session limits and allowed actions, and check pool credit balance.

subcommandsRich.name: join
subcommandsRich.desc: Deploy an agent to your current voice channel

subcommandsRich.name: list
subcommandsRich.desc: List available agents in the community pool

subcommandsRich.name: style
subcommandsRich.desc: Set the persona and tone for the session

name: ai
summary: AI chat with slash command interface
description: Chat with an AI model directly from a slash command. Creates a contextual conversation. Most users prefer !ask for quick messages; /ai is better for structured back-and-forth.

name: verify
description: Configure a verification step new members must complete before gaining access to the server. Supports button click, reaction, or CAPTCHA-style text entry.

name: polls
description: Create polls with up to 10 options, set a duration, and optionally restrict voting to specific roles. Results posted when poll ends.

name: giveaway
description: Start a timed giveaway, set winners count, require a role to enter, and re-roll if needed. Results are announced automatically.

name: remind
description: Schedule a reminder for yourself or a channel. Supports natural-language time parsing (e.g. 'in 2 hours', 'tomorrow at 9am').

name: embed
description: Interactive embed builder — set title, description, color, fields, image, footer, and author. Send to any channel you have permission for.
